context: The word 'lehdistö' in Finnish refers to the press, meaning newspapers and other news media. It is a noun that can be inflected for different grammatical cases (nominative, genitive, partitive etc.) as shown in the dictionary definition. The suffix '-stö' indicates a collection of something, so 'lehdistö' literally means a collection of 'lehti' which translates to newspaper. You will see it used in compounds like 'lehdistötiedote' meaning press release.
